attributes.action: create a new VHF or UHF allocation for CB Radio (Citizens' Band Radio) allowing medium to long range communications
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
CB Radio on both the UK and European "CEPT" channels are now free to use without a license. However, users are legally restricted to 4 watts. 27MHz is not a particularly good frequency to use due to interference, propagation, building penetration and noise levels. 4 watts of power cannot travel very far on a hand-held radio.

We have PMR446, also license free. This is a great improvement, however, the power output is minimal at less than half a watt. The range is too short.

We would like to see a VHF/UHF CB allocation, license free which permits:
More power (5 watts or above).
Modes other than FM.
Channelised operation.
Ability to use external antennas.
Allows encrypted data and voice.

This will allow a reasonable range for communication not offered by the existing CB and PMR446 specification. The allocation can be UK only (like the UK specific CB frequencies) so we do not need to be harmonised with the rest of the EU.

Frequencies freed from the Digital Switch over will be ideal for the new service. 10-20 channels will be enough, and to save frequencies, OFCOM can mandate a the use of a digital mode.
